text: well I think had we all known that there
was not
wmd uh I think that there have been
certainly less at least on my part a
rush to War I do not want to mislead you
however I do think and did think that
the proposition of removing Saddam
Hussein was an eminently sens one I had
some questions about the timing I would
have preferred to wait until Afghanistan
was more Consolidated but the notion of
removing something who someone who had
invaded his neighbors twice in the past
and had used wmd and his own people who
was shooting at our aircraft and British
aircraft every single day was an enly
sensible one so uh I say that
proposition was not one that found
disfavor with
me well I think think initially public
opinion was very favorable towards the
war and I think it was because of the
fear that that remained after 911 I
think uh for a long time after 911 even
in some parts of the country now we were
exporting our anger and our fear rather
than the more normal exports that the
United States has with hope and optimism
and enthusiasm and opportunity and I
think that led to sort of almost an
abulance uh as we move toward war with
Iraq uh certainly the fact that the US
Congress and the US press had been in my
view cowed by the events of 911 and were
not proceeding in a an oversight way
made it a lot easier for the
administration to go to war
